results.title: The Effect of Metformin on the Clinicopathological Features of Breast Cancer With Type 2 Diabetes
results.text_hl: ...The rate of @<m>DISEASE_Lymphatic_Metastasis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008207 @@@lymph node metastasis@@@ and the level of Ki-67/@GENE_MMP2 @GENE_4313 @@@MMP-2@@@ in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ group were significantly lower than those in the control group (P < 0.05).

citations.NLM: Min W, Wang B, Guo A, Mao G, Zhao Y, Zhang S, He R, Min Y, Huang Y. The Effect of Metformin on the Clinicopathological Features of Breast Cancer With Type 2 Diabetes World J Oncol. 2020 Feb;11(1):23-32. PMID: 32095186
citations.BibTeX: @article{32095186, title={The Effect of Metformin on the Clinicopathological Features of Breast Cancer With Type 2 Diabetes}, author={Min W and Wang B and Guo A and Mao G and Zhao Y and Zhang S and He R and Min Y and Huang Y}, journal={World J Oncol}, volume={11}, number={1}, pages={23-32}}

results.title: Metformin Is Associated with a Favorable Outcome in Diabetic Patients with Cervical Lymph Node Metastasis of Differentiated Thyroid Cancer.
results.text_hl: However, @<m>DISEASE_Lymphatic_Metastasis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008207 @@@cervical lymph node (LN) metastasis@@@ was more prevalent in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ group than in the nonmetformin group (OR 3.52, p = 0.035).

citations.NLM: Jang EK, Kim WG, Kwon H, Choi YM, Jeon MJ, Kim TY, Shong YK, Kim WB, Kim EY. Metformin Is Associated with a Favorable Outcome in Diabetic Patients with Cervical Lymph Node Metastasis of Differentiated Thyroid Cancer. Eur Thyroid J. 2015 Sep;4(3):181-8. PMID: 26558235
